IdentityCredential.summary: NOTE Experimental The IdentityCredential interface of the Federated Credential Management API (FedCM) represents a user identity credential arising from a successful federated sign-in.

remarks.para: A successful call that includes an identity option fulfills with an IdentityCredential instance.

IdentityCredentialConfigURL.summary: NOTE Experimental The configURL read-only property of the interface returns a string specifying the config file URL of the {{glossary("Identity provider", "identity provider")}} (IdP) used for sign-in.

remarks.para: See Provide a config file for more information.

IdentityCredentialDisconnect.summary: NOTE Experimental The disconnect() static method of the interface disconnects a specified federated sign-in account from the {{glossary("Identity provider", "IdP")}} used to obtain the credential.

remarks.para: Afterwards, using that account for federated login requires starting the federated sign-in process again.

IdentityCredentialIsAutoSelected.summary: NOTE Experimental The isAutoSelected read-only property of the interface indicates whether the federated sign-in flow was carried out using auto-reauthentication (i.e., without user mediation) or not.

remarks.para: Automatic reauthentication can occur when a call is issued with a mediation option value of "optional" or "silent". It is useful for a Relying party (RP) to know whether auto reauthentication occurred for analytics/performance evaluation and for UX purposes â€” automatic sign-in may warrant a different UI flow to non-automatic sign-in.

IdentityCredentialIsAutoSelected.value: A boolean value. true indicates that automatic reauthentication was used; false indicates that it was not.

IdentityCredentialToken.summary: NOTE Experimental The token read-only property of the interface returns the token used to validate the associated sign-in.

remarks.para: The FedCM API does not define the structure of the token object or what the RP should do with it: this depends entirely on the federated identity protocol that the IdP implements.
When an RP chooses to work with a particular IdP, they will provide instructions for how to interpret and use the returned token value.
